title: How Many Calories in Ribs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in ribs per 100 g serving, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, and tips for variations like sauced vs. dry.
assumptions: Pork baby back ribs, cooked (barbecued), bone-in, with moderate BBQ sauce; trimmed of excess fat.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rib type (pork vs. beef), cut, cooking method, sauce, and portion size. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked pork ribs provides ~292 kcal, with high protein and fat content.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Beef short ribs instead of pork

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g of pork ribs?
faqs.a: Approximately 292 kcal for cooked pork ribs with sauce.
Yes, 100 g provides about 23 g protein, great for muscle building.

faqs.q: How does sauce affect calories in ribs?
faqs.a: BBQ sauce adds ~50 kcal per 100 g; opt for dry rubs to reduce.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in ribs?
faqs.a: Around 21 g total fat per 100 g, including 7.5 g saturated.

faqs.q: Do beef ribs have more calories than pork?
faqs.a: Yes, beef short ribs often have ~60 more kcal per 100 g due to higher fat.
